questions.question: What is the primary economic advantage of transitioning from 1-on-1 coaching to a group coaching model?
options: It allows the coach to charge more per individual client
It eliminates the need for any marketing or lead generation
It significantly increases the coach's Revenue Per Hour (RPH) through scalability
It requires less technical knowledge than 1-on-1 consulting
questions.explanation: Group coaching allows a coach to serve multiple clients simultaneously, decoupling income from hours worked and significantly increasing the Revenue Per Hour (RPH).

questions.question: In the 6-Week S.L.U.M.B.E.R. Group Curriculum, what does the 'U' represent in the second week of the program?
options: Universal Sleep Training
Understanding Individual Needs & Temperament
Underlying Medical Conditions
Uninterrupted Sleep Goals
questions.explanation: The 'U' stands for Understanding, focusing on developmental milestones, sleep temperament, and the unique biological needs of the child before implementing behavioral changes.

questions.question: A participant in your group program is 'monopolizing' the Q&A sessions with highly specific, non-generalizable questions. What is the recommended facilitation technique?
options: Mute the participant and ignore their future questions
End the call early to avoid conflict
Acknowledge the unique situation and offer to address it via the community forum or a brief 'breakout' to keep the group on track
Spend the entire session answering their questions to ensure they feel heard
questions.explanation: Effective facilitation involves redirecting the conversation to benefit the whole group while providing an alternative path for the individual's specific concerns, such as a community post.

questions.question: Which component of the 'Tech Stack' is most vital for ensuring a group program can scale to 50+ participants without increasing administrative burden?
options: A high-quality webcam
An automated onboarding sequence and Learning Management System (LMS)
Manual PayPal invoicing for every participant
A personal cell phone for 24/7 texting
questions.explanation: Automation through an LMS and onboarding sequences allows the delivery of content and instructions without manual intervention for every new student.

questions.question: According to marketing data for child sleep workshops, what is a typical 'healthy' conversion rate for a live webinar (attendees to program enrollees)?
questions.explanation: While it varies, a well-optimized sleep coaching webinar typically sees a conversion rate between 5% and 15% of live attendees.

questions.question: When pitching a Corporate Seminar to an HR department, which metric is most likely to secure the contract?
options: The number of Instagram followers the coach has
The aesthetic quality of the sleep logs
Data regarding reduced employee absenteeism and improved productivity for parents
The specific brand of white noise machine recommended
questions.explanation: Corporate clients (B2B) prioritize 'Return on Investment' (ROI), focusing on how sleep coaching improves employee performance and reduces costs associated with sleep-deprived staff.

questions.question: What is the primary characteristic of a 'Hybrid Model' in sleep coaching?
options: Coaching both toddlers and newborns at the same time
Combining pre-recorded digital modules with live group support calls
Offering both sleep coaching and nutritional advice
Using both virtual and in-person methods for every single client
questions.explanation: The Hybrid Model uses 'flipped classroom' logic, where clients learn the theory via recorded modules and use live time for high-value coaching and troubleshooting.

questions.question: During the 'M' (Management & Method) phase of the S.L.U.M.B.E.R. curriculum, what is the coach's main role?
options: Changing the nursery curtains
Guiding parents through the implementation of their chosen behavioral sleep strategy
Selling the client a new mattress
Diagnosing sleep apnea
questions.explanation: The Management phase (usually Week 4) is the 'active' training phase where the coach supports the parents in consistently applying the chosen behavioral intervention.

questions.question: If you run a 6-week group program for 10 parents at $300 each, and it takes you 12 hours total to manage, what is your Revenue Per Hour (RPH)?
questions.explanation: Total Revenue ($3,000) divided by Total Hours (12) equals $250 RPH.

questions.question: Which strategy is most effective for 'Post-Program Retention' after a 6-week group concludes?
options: Closing the group and deleting all materials
Offering a low-cost 'Alumni Membership' for ongoing monthly Q&A and community support
Requiring all parents to sign up for 1-on-1 coaching
Providing a full refund if the baby has one bad night
questions.explanation: An Alumni Membership provides recurring revenue for the coach and continued peace of mind for parents as they navigate future regressions or milestones.
